alert.note: Alert for Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 13 at 1:35PM AKST until February 15 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TUESDAY TO MIDNIGHT AKST TUESDAY NIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 65 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 AM Tuesday to midnight AKST Tuesday night. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Tuesday night through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility with large snow drifts developing. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means there is a potential for falling and/or blowing snow with strong winds and extremely poor visibilities. This can lead to whiteout conditions and make travel very difficult.
